responses.Citizen: Hello! How can I help you with your complaint today?
responses.Moderator: Hello Moderator — how can I help you manage complaints?

responses.Citizen: Go to Submit Complaint, fill title, category, description, location and attach a photo.
responses.Moderator: Use the Submit Complaint form to register a new citizen complaint; moderators can also assign complaints.
Showing complaints assigned to your department.

responses.Citizen: Use the Auto-Detect Current Location button on the complaint form and allow location permissions.
responses.Moderator: The same; moderators view location in complaint details.

responses.Citizen: Upload a clear image. The app will run an AI check and warn if image quality is bad.
responses.Moderator: Moderators can view pending photo validations in Moderator Complaints.

responses.Citizen: Departments are assigned automatically based on category. You can also select a department if visible.
responses.Moderator: You can see complaints assigned to your department on the moderator dashboard.
You're welcome — let me know if you need more moderation tools.

responses.Citizen: You can view counts on your Dashboard.
responses.Moderator: I can show total complaints for your department; open Moderator Dashboard.

responses.Citizen: I can help — try: Submit Complaint, Track Issues, or Nearby Issues. Use the menu on the left.
responses.Moderator: I can guide you — use the Moderator Dashboard for department stats, Moderator Complaints to moderate, and Moderator Profile to update your info.
